meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a hog in greed or filthiness.
meanings.sent1: The man's hoggish behavior at the buffet disgusted others.
meanings.sent2: She had a hoggish appetite and ate all the cookies.
meanings.sent3: His hoggish ways at the table made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The hoggish politician grabbed all the attention for himself.
meanings.sent5: The hoggish child hoarded all the toys for himself.

meanings.definition: Greedy or selfish in a way that suggests a pig.
meanings.sent1: The hoggish businessman never shared his profits with others.
meanings.sent2: She had a hoggish desire for more and more presents.
meanings.sent3: His hoggish attitude towards sharing upset his friends.
meanings.sent4: The hoggish neighbor always took the biggest slice of cake.
meanings.sent5: The hoggish squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the tree.

meanings.sent1: The hoggish eater finished the entire pizza by himself.
meanings.sent2: She felt hoggish after eating too much ice cream.
meanings.sent3: His hoggish behavior at the all-you-can-eat buffet was comical.
meanings.sent4: The hoggish monster in the story devoured everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The hoggish king demanded a feast every night.
